newsitem.title: USA: Computer Associates falls after forecast.
newsitem.headline: Computer Associates falls after forecast.

text.p: The stock of Computer Associates International Inc. tumbled Friday, a day after the software company predicted lower than expected revenues in the current quarter.
The stock fell $11.375 or 18 percent to $50.375 on the New York Stock Exchange, making it the market's biggest loser.
Morgan Stanley cut its rating on Computer Associates stock to outperform from strong buy.

The maker of business software said after the market closed on Thursday that revenues for its third quarter ending on Dec. 31 would fall below Wall Street's $1.2 billion estimate and would be between $1 billion and $1.1 billion. It cited weakness in Europe.
But Computer Associates also said that analysts' average earnings forecasts of 75 cents a share "appeared achievable."
The company, based in Islandia, N.Y., on Long Island, employs 9,000 people in 130 offices in 40 countries and had revenues of more than $3.5 billion in its last fiscal year.
